thread.title: Barack Obama Greeted by Cheering Crowd While Stepping Out in New York City
thread.title_full: Barack Obama Greeted by Cheering Crowd While Stepping Out in New York City

author: Jackie Willis
title: Barack Obama Greeted by Cheering Crowd While Stepping Out in New York City
text: Barack Obama Greeted by Cheering Crowd While Stepping Out in New York City by Jackie Willis 1:03 PM   Photo: Getty Images New York City pedestrians couldn't have been more thrilled to spot former President Barack Obam a on a city street. The onetime commander in chief drew a large crowd when he stepped out of a NYC office building, sans necktie, on Friday afternoon. While heading to his motorcade, Obam a , who was holding a disposable coffee cup, was met with cheers as he waved to onlookers before smoothly putting on his sunglasses and driving off. It's not yet known why Obam a , 55, is in the city, but his oldest daughter, Malia, will reportedly start interning at the NY office of The Weinstein Company next month. President Obama leaving 160 5th ave just now pic.twitter.com/kowtqnif9W — Allan Smith (@akarl_smith) February 24, 2017 Obama's in Flatiron and all I saw was some phones pic.twitter.com/RPQtt10nmg — Kate H. Taylor (@Kate_H_Taylor) February 24, 2017 Obama casually getting some coffee outside of the DoSomething office. pic.twitter.com/bWqfPjc0Ix — Luke Patton (@friendofpixels) February 24, 2017 Obam a 's recent visit to the Big Apple comes after he and his wife, Michelle Obama , jetted off to the British Virgin Islands for a vacation following the inauguration of President Donald Trump last month. The 44th U.S. president became a viral sensation during his trip, thanks to his kite-surfing adventure and a backwards hat style statement. Check out the envy-worthy getaway: RELATED SLIDESHOW
